name: Sotano del Arroyo
description:
This is a fantastic pit cave with extensive borehole passage with lots of formations and multiple drops. The highlight of the trip described here is an underground methane rich lake full of blind fish, which usually marks the turn around point for most groups.

The cave is known to have high levels of CO2, especially in the passages past the methane lake and lower reaches of the cave. Bring a lighter or other air monitor and turn around at 4%.

Approach

From Los Sabinos II town drive on a dirt road south west to the mapped parking location. From there cross a cattle gate on the side of the road and hike through the jungle (watch out for bees) following the track on the map until you reach the gaping entrance pit.

Descent

To get to the lake and back up should take about 9h.

  • R1 (8 handline) 30' rappel or handline
  • R2 (Entrance Sink) 100' from an arch on right side of solution pocket. The entrance to the cave is just past this drop. To follow the passage soon will require wading in pools up to knee deep.
  • R3 (bypass) 30' rappel or handline, we did not try the bypass
  • R4 (drop 6) 60' rappel down a rimstone waterfall, rig from chockstone in the streambed, leave something to help climb back the difficult lip
  • R5 (drop 10) 90' rappel down into the Triangular Room noted in the Cave Map
  • R6 (Lake Drop) 100' rappel down into the Reddell's Lake noted in the Cave Map, last part is completely overhang and drops in the middle of a deep lake
  • Lake : Once in the lake, swim 50' towards the shore following the direction of the drop. Don't go to the shore on the right.
  • Shore: be careful if you play with the methane, watch this video to see what can happen

This lake is reached about 1km into the cave, at a depth of 100m down from the top of the first rappel ('8 handline') at the end of the Arroyo. It is the point marked as "Reddell's Lake", and "Lake Drop" in about the center of the map. The entire cave has more than 7km of mapped passageway, and as you can see from the map goes much further. Getting to the lake and back will take most groups around 9h and thus is already a full day.

Exit

You will be able to see the rope from the shore. Swim back and ascend the rope, then continue the progression back out of the cave and to the car you left parked on the road.

Red tape
